results.title: Red ensign
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Jerome Jackson and Michael Powell
results.brief_description: This is the story of David Barr, a shipbuilder, who fights to keep the shipyards open during the Depression of the 1930’s. David Barr fights the cautious businessman, Lord Dean, both for the affection of the heiress, June MacKinnon, and for the use of her money to finance his construction program. Stars Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Alfred Drayton, Frank Vosper.

results.title: Red Dwarf I. The End
results.brief_description: This tape features the pilot show for the series, “The End”, in which bickering room mates and co-maintenance workers Rimmer and Lister are the sole survivors of the mining ship Red Dwarf after it suffers severe radiation, thanks to an incorrectly sealed drive plate courtesy of Rimmer. Joining the human Lister and hologram Rimmer, are computer Holly and Rimmer’s cat who has now come to life. “Future echoes”: The Red Dwarf breaks the light barrier and Holly is having trouble navigating. Cat’s having trouble narrowing down the number of suits he can take into stasis in preparation, and Lister and Rimmer are subjected to future echoes - visions of what lies ahead. “Balance of power”: Lister reminisces about Saturday nights gone past carousing with fellow crew members. He threatens to pass the officer’s exam so that Rimmer will no longer wield power over him and give himself the authority to achieve everything he desires; cigarettes and a holographic Kochanski. Cast includes: Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Norman Lovett. Episodes written by Rob Grant and Doug Naylor. According to the official “Red Dwarf” website, the series is BBC2’s longest running and highest rating sit-com. A film is due for completion in September 2003.

results.title: Red Dwarf I. Confidence & paranoia
results.brief_description: All inhabitants of mining ship Red Dwarf perish in a radiation leak, except for Dave Lister, safely secluded in suspended animation during the incident, revived years later with companions Rimmer (a hologram of a dead crew member) and Cat (an incarnation of his pregnant cat). All occurs under the watchful eye of the ship’s computer, talking head Holly. According to the official “Red Dwarf” website, the series is BBC2’s longest running and highest rating sit-com. A film is due for completion in September 2003. “Confidence & paranoia”: Lister contracts mutated pneumonia and suffers from weird hallucinations that come to life as raining herrings, a combustible Warsaw mayor and two beings who are manifestations of Rimmer’s confidence and paranoia. High on his list is being reunited with a holographic projection of navigation officer Kochanski. “Waiting for god”: Holly notices an unidentifiable object - a pod - on the radar. When the alien capsule is safely landed on the Red Dwarf, Rimmer is convinced it contains the remains of an ancient warrior, only Holly and Lister know the “dirty” truth. Lister is convinced he is a god and king to the race of cats. “ME2”: Rimmer’s complaint that Lister is holding him back from a fulfilling life provokes him into creating a more worthy companion: a duplicate hologram of himself. There’s only room for one Rimmer on the ship however, one of them has to go. Cast includes: Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Norman Lovett. Episodes written by Rob Grant and Doug Naylor.

results.title: Red dust
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Victor Fleming Productions, Victor Fleming and Hunt Stromberg
results.brief_description: Based on a play by Wilson Collison, “Red Dust” is a fiery romance drama set on a rubber plantation in Vietnam. Dennis Carson (Clark Gable) is happy in the ‘male’ world of the rubber plantation which he runs. Then one day Vantine (Jean Harlow), a brassy blonde floozy escaping from some ‘trouble’ in Saigon arrives at the plantation. The sparks fly as Vantine wears down Carson’s gruff exterior with her special charms. Then Gary Willis (Gene Raymond) a surveyor arrives with his earnest, refined wife Barbara (Mary Astor). Tensions rise as Carson dumps Vantine and begins pursuing Barbara. Directed by Victor Fleming, “Red Dust” perfectly teams the masculine and feminine sexual personas of Harlow and Gable. In 1953 the film was remade, again with Gable, as “Mogambo”.

results.title: Red boots for Christmas
results.brief_description: Hans the shoemaker shuts himself off from the Christmas preparations going on around him in his German village, as he has no family and few friends. One night he is visited by an angel who promises him a special gift at Christmas. He crafts a special pair of red boots to give in return. As the story unfolds, Hans learns the pleasure of caring and giving to others, and finally realises that this is his gift from God. Based on “Die Roten stiefel” by Dr. Paul Christoph and produced by the Lutheran Church.

results.title: Red Beard = Akahige
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: The last collaboration between actor Toshiro Mifune and Kurosawa, is a moral tale about a young and arrogant medical graduate - charged by his modern training and ambition - who is devastated to be assigned to an impoverished local clinic. The young doctor’s mentor, Red Beard, aims to show the young gun that there is more to life than prestige and power and more to healing than medicine. Set in 1820, this is a poignant and compassionate work; a humanistic narrative that follows the character’s arc from supercilious to empathetic whilst presenting a myriad of stories about the villagers and their struggles.

results.title: Red ball express
results.brief_description: To the music of “Orange Blossom Special” a train changes shape and colour. The impressionistic animation is drawn directly onto the film. Music played by Cecil Creasey.

results.title: Recycling: it's everybody's job
results.brief_description: Garbage - where does it all go? Most of it is burned in incinerators or buried in landfills, which just get bigger and bigger. This video explains and explores recycling, another way to handle the garbage problem. Follow rubbish from household recycling bins through collection to a separation plant, where the different types of materials get sorted. Students will see examples of how a bag of rubbish can be made useful again. Also investigates the usefulness of composting to help with recycling. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
